title: How was China before the Opium War? - Quora

response.answer_text: Qing China was intact before the Taiping, Nian, Muslim, and other rebellions of the 1850s and 60s, and the world’s largest economy, considered rich by foreign traders. Beijing, Canton, and most of the coast were not ravaged by the rebellions, but most of the interior was, and finally even the rich Jiangnan region that had led China’s economy for a millennium, reorienting it from Suzhou to the new foreign-controlled Shanghai where refugees from the war gathered. Qing rule also shifted from having large centers at both Beijing and Nanjing, to just Beijing with many central areas only recaptured by locally raised armies that continued to have some independence.
